learning_outcomes.description: Critically reflect on your previous experiences in coaching and in higher education to identify areas of potential interest for further investigation
Demonstrate an understanding of methodological approaches and select those most appropriate for their given topic
Understand ethical clearance procedures and conduct research in ethically sound ways
Independently research and critically evaluate an area of inquiry relevant to your own and others' coaching contexts
Critically evaluate relevant theory and previous empirical research to make informed, convincing and justified decisions

assessments.task_description: Coaches must nominate their preferred topic for investigation accompanied with a sound and well-supported rationale drawing upon aspects of their previous coursework (e.g. SPCG7030), coach education materials from their sport, hot topics in the popular press, and/or other sources.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submit via the relevant Turnitin submission portal on the course Blackboard site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: Having agreed on a topic, coaches must propose an appropriate methodological approach to answer their research Qs. Submissions must be well supported and demonstrate a sound understanding of methodological issues.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submit via the relevant Turnitin submission portal on the course Blackboard site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: Coaches must demonstrate an understanding of ethical clearance proceduresÂ prior to commencement of the research project (some may progress to formal ethical clearance procedures where appropriate)
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submit via the relevant Turnitin submission portal on the course Blackboard site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: Coaches submit a brief report outlining the progress of their Thesis. This includes work completed and modified timelines for submission.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submit via the relevant Turnitin submission portal on the course Blackboard site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: Coaches submit a research report in a form to be negotiated (e.g., 'publishable' paper, research report, presentation and executive summary).
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submit via the relevant Turnitin submission portal on the course Blackboard site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.topic:
Thesis

Coaches will undertake their approved research project and write up findings in an appropriate form

Learning outcomes: L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Thesis Coaches will undertake their approved research project and write up findings in an appropriate form

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 2(24 Feb - 09 Mar)
learning_activities.topic:
Formulating your topic

Coaches will begin to formulate a topic for their Thesis through various means including (but not limited to) revisiting aspects of their previous coursework (e.g. topic they chose in SPCG7030), Coach education materials from their sport (e.g. psychology modules), and hot topics in the popular media (e.g. concussion). Coaches will then share ideas with the course coordinator and peers.


Learning outcomes: L01
learning_activities.topic_description: Formulating your topic Coaches will begin to formulate a topic for their Thesis through various means including (but not limited to) revisiting aspects of their previous coursework (e.g. topic they chose in SPCG7030), Coach education materials from their sport (e.g. psychology modules), and hot topics in the popular media (e.g. concussion). Coaches will then share ideas with the course coordinator and peers.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 3 To Week 6(10 Mar - 06 Apr)
learning_activities.topic:
Research proposal

Having agreed on a topic, coaches must propose an appropriate methodological approach to answer their research Qs


Learning outcomes: L02
learning_activities.topic_description: Research proposal Having agreed on a topic, coaches must propose an appropriate methodological approach to answer their research Qs

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 7 To Week 12(07 Apr - 25 May)
learning_activities.topic:
Ethical clearance

After incorporating any feedback related to their proposal, coaches must complete the ethical clearance protocol


Learning outcomes: L02, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Ethical clearance After incorporating any feedback related to their proposal, coaches must complete the ethical clearance protocol

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 12 To Exam week 2(19 May - 22 Jun)

Learning outcomes: L04, L05
